base_description: Slim, cylindrical pen with gray and red colors.
part_description: The pen has a gray body and a red tip. The cylindrical body is long and slender, with a cap or click mechanism at the top. The tip is pointed for writing purposes, positioned at the lower end.
internal_interaction_description: The pen's internal mechanism likely includes a retractable or capped ink cartridge. The ink flows from the cartridge through the body to the tip when pressure is applied during writing. The cap or click mechanism may serve to protect the tip and prevent ink drying.
external_interaction_description: The pen interacts with paper or other writing surfaces, transferring ink to create marks. It is typically held by a person, who applies pressure to write or draw. The pen may also be stored in pockets, pen holders, or bags when not in use.
